sentences.sentence: Russia's continued war in Ukraine, conflict in the Middle East and climate threats are all hampering the EU's economic growth predictions for 2024.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Farmers continue to protest in Poland, Spain and France as discontent with EU policies persists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Israeli forces stormed in Nazar Hospital in Kan Yunis seeking for hostages taken by Hamas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Hours before, Israeli fire killed a patient and wounded six, only a day after the army sought to evacuate thousands of displaced who had taken shelter at Nazer Hospital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Israeli military spokesman said that forces were conducting a precise, unlimited operation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We have credible intelligence from a number of sources, including from released hostages, indicating that Hamas held hostages at the Nasser Hospital in Chaniounis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We emphasized that there is no obligation for patients or staff to evacuate the hospital. However, we have been urging other Gazans in Arabic, on the phone and via loudspeakers to move away from the danger that Hamas puts them in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Via a humanitarian corridor we opened for this purpose." Nasser, which is the main hospital in southern Gaza, has reportedly been besieged since February 6, according to the World Health Organization.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The organization is also denouncing that the last time they were able to access the hospital was on January 29.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A recent UN report said Israel has carried out more than 350 attacks on healthcare facilities in Gaza since October 7. Several people are reported to have been killed in airstrikes in both Ukraine and Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, missiles hit targets in multiple regions across Ukraine, damaging homes and infrastructure facilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Crews and ballistic missiles were fired at locations as far west as Lviv, close to the border with Poland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A number of people were injured in the strikes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian officials say some of at least 10 projectiles were intercepted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Kupiansk in the east was also hit, and at least two people were said to have died in the overnight assault.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia has in recent weeks intensified air attacks while Ukraine has also stepped up cross-border strikes into Russia. The governor of Belgorod region says six people were killed and 18 injured in the border city in Russia when a barrage of Ukrainian missiles struck a shopping mall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Union missiles struck a shopping mall. Russian authorities may be generating enough new forces to sustain losses caused by the current tempo of their offensive operations in Ukraine through 2025, says the Institute for the Study of War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The UK Defence Ministry recently said that the average daily number of russian casualties in ukraine has risen by almost 300 during the course of 2023. if the numbers continue the current rate over the next year russia will have lost over half a million personnel in ukraine in early december it reported that the assaults on avdivka have resulted in 90 increase in russian casualties casualties Ukraine said on Thursday it was withdrawing troops from some parts of the eastern town of Avdiivka to better position after a month of heavy fighting Ukraine's third assault Brigade considered to be one of Ukraine's largest and best equipped confirmed that it was urgently redeployed to Avdiivka adding that the situation in the area is quote hell and extremely and extremely critical. The Institute for the Study of War says that there are no confirmed changes to the frontline in this area, although Russian forces reportedly advanced in the south and north of Avdiivka. Russian sources claim that Russian forces advanced to or even beyond the main Ukrainian ground line of communication in Avdiivka along Industrial Avenue, which then becomes Grushevskogo Street.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian military sources say that the supply and evacuation of Avdiivka has become challenging, but alternative logistics routes prepared in advance have been activated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Greek parliament on Thursday approved the legislation of same-sex civil marriage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Polls showed that the majority of Greeks were in favor of the bill drawn up by the center-right government and supported by four left-wing parties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Greek Orthodox Church was against it. The bill grants full parental rights on married same-sex partners with children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Yet it precludes gay couples from parenthood through surrogate mothers in Greece.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The issue has divided Greeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: LGBTQI plus organizations have led the marches in support of the bill. Russia's continued war in Ukraine is still affecting the EU's economic growth, as is

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: the conflict in the Middle East.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Disruptions in trade are also being felt due to the attacks by Houthis on Western ships in the Red Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Climate risks and frequent extreme weather also remains a threat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Taking all factors into account, the European Commission has downgraded its winter economic forecast published on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Growth in the EU and the Euro area is now estimated at 0.5% in 2023, marginally below our autumn projections. For 2024, GDP growth is estimated at 0.9, which is 0.4 lower than projected in autumn. In 2025, the EU economy is forecast to expand by 1.77 unchanged from the previous forecast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For the euro area we project growth at 0.8 this year and 1.5 in 2025.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A leading Bruegel Institute analyst in Brussels said the good news is that energy prices are abating.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Since the European economy is a net importer of energy, it implies that it's very sensitive and vulnerable also to possible energy price changes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But the good news is that all three main types of energy, petroleum, gas and electricity, the prices went back to values where before the start of the war and also forecast and market expectations suggest that these energy prices will remain low. The European Commission has also said that as inflation continues falling, real wages will rise and with that, consumption will also increase. The forecast expects trade with foreign partners to even out after last year's poor performance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Unrest on Europe's streets as farmers continue to protest. In Poland, demonstrations and roadblocks continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Farmers there blocked the roads leading up to the border crossing with Ukraine as they denounced unfair competition from their neighbouring war-torn country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They oppose measures introduced by the EU to lift tariffs on agricultural imports from Ukraine which they say depress their prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Spain, protests entered their tenth consecutive day in several regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Dozens of tractors also reached the Ministry of Agriculture in Madrid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Spanish farmers say rural Spain is facing a crisis and ask for a crackdown on food imports from non-EU countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Protests continue in France, where they first erupted and where farmers say the government's concessions are not having an impact.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They blocked the access to the famous Chateau de Chambord in the Loire Valley.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It was supposed to be a celebration for the Kansas City Chiefs Super Bowl winners,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: but a shooting turned it into a tragedy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: One person died and more than 22 people were shot at the end of the parade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Eight children were among the wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The gunfire caused the watching crowd, including the city's mayor and his family members, to run for cover.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Investigations are still underway to discover a motive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Hospitals say they are treating not only gunshot wounds but also people who had suffered other injuries in the sudden stampede that the shooting caused.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In a statement, the Kansas City Chief said all of its players, coaches and staff, as well as their family members, are safe and accounted for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The shooting was at least the 48th mass shooting in the United States so far this year, according to the Gun Violence Archive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A Russian citizen in Sweden is facing deportation back to Russia, where he will be forced to fight in the war against Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Sergei Podobny lives in the coastal northern city of Lulia with his wife Irina and his 14-year-old son Ivan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Sergei says his relatives in Russia have received his military conscription order.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Yet, the Swedish government is determining whether it is legitimate or not. As Ukrainian citizens, Sergei's wife and son are allowed to stay in Sweden.

sentences.sentence: Norwegian far-right extremist Anders Behring Breivik on Thursday lost his second attempt to sue the state for allegedly breaching his human rights whilst in prison.
